intro: Helittophyllum parviflorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helittophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the cooler months. Helittophyllum parviflorum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
